intro: Biscutella orcelitana, commonly known as the alpine biscuitroot, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and basal rosette of narrow, hairy leaves. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows. Biscutella orcelitana is adapted to cold climates and is typically found at high altitudes.
